text: The presence of an impurity in substance will cause the melting point to
explanation:
Impurities disrupt the repeating pattern of forces that holds the solid together. So a smaller amount of energy is required to melt the part of the solid surrounding the impurity. If less energy is required, then this explains the melting point depression (lowering) observed from impure solids. The more impure the solid is, the more the structure is disrupted and the greater the variation in intermolecular forces in different areas of the solid.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the laboratory preparation of ammonia, the flask is placed in a slanting position so as to

options.A: prevent condensed water from breaking the reaction flask
options.B: enable the proper mixing of the reactions in the flask

text: In the graph above, the activation energy of the catalyzed reaction is
explanation:
In the graph above, the activation energy of the catalyzed reaction is shown by the curve with the broken lines. Tracing it to the peak of the hump and extrapolating, we have 200kJ. However, to find the activation energy, it is the difference between the energy of the peak of the hump and energy of the reactant.
i.e   Activation energy = Energy at the peak of the hump - energy of the reactant
= 200 - 100
= 100kJ

text: Use the following option above to answer this question. Which of the following compounds in solution will turn red litmus paper blue?
explanation:
RNH\(_2\), a general representation for an amine, turns red litmus paper blue because amines are basic in nature. When an amine is dissolved in water, it acts as a base, accepting a proton (H+) and forming a conjugate acid and a hydroxide ion (OH-). The presence of hydroxide ions makes the solution alkaline, and alkaline solutions turn red litmus paper blue.
